# Operational Playbook Creator: PetPulse

**Generated by:** StratArts Operational Playbook Creator
**Date:** December 2025
**Business:** PetPulse - Smart Pet Health Monitoring

---

## Executive Summary

This operational playbook defines the systems, processes, and workflows required to run PetPulse efficiently from launch through scale. It covers customer operations, product fulfillment, vet network management, technology operations, and team coordination.

**Operational Philosophy:** "Systems over heroics"
**Target:** 10,000 customers with <15 FTE support load

---

## Organizational Structure

### Team Organization (Year 1)

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    ORGANIZATIONAL CHART                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                 │
│                         CEO/Founder                             │
│                             │                                   │
│         ┌───────────────────┼───────────────────┐               │
│         │                   │                   │               │
│         ▼                   ▼                   ▼               │
│    ┌─────────┐        ┌─────────┐        ┌─────────┐           │
│    │  CTO    │        │  Head   │        │  Head   │           │
│    │ Product │        │  Ops    │        │ Growth  │           │
│    └────┬────┘        └────┬────┘        └────┬────┘           │
│         │                  │                  │                 │
│    ┌────┴────┐        ┌────┴────┐        ┌────┴────┐           │
│    │ Eng (4) │        │ CX (3)  │        │ Mktg(2) │           │
│    │ Design(1)│       │ Vet Ops │        │         │           │
│    └─────────┘        │   (2)   │        └─────────┘           │
│                       └─────────┘                               │
│                                                                 │
│    Total Headcount: 15 FTE                                      │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Role Definitions

| Role | FTE | Primary Responsibilities |
|------|-----|--------------------------|
| CEO/Founder | 1 | Strategy, fundraising, partnerships |
| CTO | 1 | Product vision, architecture, team |
| Head of Operations | 1 | CX, fulfillment, vet network |
| Head of Growth | 1 | Marketing, acquisition, retention |
| Software Engineers | 4 | App, backend, AI/ML, firmware |
| Product Designer | 1 | UX/UI, brand design |
| Customer Experience | 3 | Support, onboarding, success |
| Vet Network Operations | 2 | Vet recruitment, scheduling, QA |
| Marketing | 2 | Content, social, campaigns |

## Customer Operations

### Customer Lifecycle

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                   CUSTOMER LIFECYCLE                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                 │
│  ACQUIRE         ONBOARD          ENGAGE           RETAIN       │
│  ────────        ────────         ───────          ───────      │
│  Website         Order confirm    Daily app use    Renewal      │
│  Ads             Shipping         Telehealth       Win-back     │
│  Referrals       Setup wizard     Alerts           Referral     │
│  PR              Day 1-7 emails   Reports          Advocacy     │
│                                                                 │
│  KPIs:           KPIs:            KPIs:            KPIs:        │
│  • CAC           • Setup rate     • DAU/MAU        • Annual     │
│  • CVR           • Time to Aha    • Telehealth     retention    │
│  • ROAS          • D7 retention   usage            • NPS        │
│                                   • Alert          • LTV        │
│                                   engagement                    │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Support Operations

**Channels:**
- In-app chat (primary) - Intercom
- Email support - support@petpulse.com
- Phone (escalations only) - Callback within 2 hours

**Support Tiers:**

| Tier | Handle | SLA | Examples |
|------|--------|-----|----------|
| Tier 1 | Automated | Instant | FAQ, order status, account |
| Tier 2 | CX Team | <2 hours | Setup issues, billing, general |
| Tier 3 | Specialist | <4 hours | Technical, vet complaints, returns |
| Tier 4 | Escalation | <24 hours | Legal, executive complaints |

**Support Hours:**
- Chat: 7am-10pm ET, 7 days
- Email: 24-hour response SLA
- Phone: 9am-6pm ET, Mon-Fri

**Support Metrics Targets:**

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| First Response Time | <15 minutes (chat) |
| Resolution Time | <4 hours |
| CSAT Score | 90%+ |
| First Contact Resolution | 70%+ |
| Ticket Volume per Customer | <0.5/month |

### Support Playbooks

**Setup Issues (Most Common):**
```
1. Bluetooth pairing failed
   → Send video link
   → Walk through troubleshooting steps
   → If persistent, escalate to Tier 3 + offer call

2. Collar fit concerns
   → Send sizing guide video
   → Offer size exchange (free shipping)
   → Remind of 30-day fit guarantee

3. App connectivity issues
   → Check phone compatibility
   → Verify latest app version
   → Clear cache, reinstall if needed
```

**Billing Issues:**
```
1. Failed payment
   → Auto-retry 3x over 5 days
   → Email notification on Day 1, 3, 5
   → Pause service on Day 7
   → Grace period before cancellation (14 days)

2. Refund request (<30 days)
   → Process immediately
   → Return shipping label
   → Refund on receipt

3. Subscription cancellation
   → Offer pause option (3 months)
   → Offer discount (20% for 3 months)
   → Process if confirmed
   → Win-back campaign at Day 30
```

---

## Product Fulfillment

### Order-to-Delivery Flow

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                   ORDER FULFILLMENT FLOW                        │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                 │
│  Order Placed ──▶ Payment ──▶ Warehouse ──▶ Ship ──▶ Deliver    │
│       │          Processed     Pick/Pack    Label    Notify     │
│       │                                                         │
│       ▼                                                         │
│  Immediate:                                                     │
│  • Confirmation email                                           │
│  • Account created (if new)                                     │
│  • App download prompt                                          │
│                                                                 │
│  Timeline:                                                      │
│  Day 0: Order placed                                            │
│  Day 1: Warehouse processes                                     │
│  Day 2: Shipped (tracking sent)                                 │
│  Day 3-5: In transit                                            │
│  Day 4-6: Delivered                                             │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Inventory Management

**Initial Production Run:** 5,000 units
**Reorder Point:** 2,000 units remaining
**Lead Time:** 8 weeks (overseas manufacturing)

**Inventory KPIs:**

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| In-Stock Rate | 98%+ |
| Days of Inventory | 60-90 days |
| Fulfillment Accuracy | 99.5%+ |
| Shipping Damage Rate | <1% |

**Inventory Forecast Model:**
```
Weekly Order Forecast = (Trailing 4-week avg) × (Seasonal factor) × (Marketing multiplier)

Safety Stock = (Daily avg sales) × (Lead time days) × (1.5 buffer)
```

### Returns & Warranty

**Return Policy:**
- 30-day no-questions-asked returns
- Free return shipping (prepaid label)
- Refund within 5 business days of receipt

**Warranty:**
- 1-year hardware warranty
- Covers manufacturing defects
- Does not cover: water damage, pet chewing, physical damage

**Return Process:**
```
1. Customer requests return (app or support)
2. System generates return label
3. Customer ships within 14 days
4. Warehouse receives + inspects
5. Refund processed (full for <30 days, prorated for warranty)
```

**Target Return Rate:** <10%

---

## Vet Network Operations

### Vet Network Overview

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    VET NETWORK STRUCTURE                        │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                 │
│  ┌─────────────┐    ┌─────────────┐    ┌─────────────┐         │
│  │  Platform   │    │   50+ Vets  │    │  Customers  │         │
│  │  (PetPulse) │◀──▶│  (Contract) │◀──▶│  (Users)    │         │
│  └─────────────┘    └─────────────┘    └─────────────┘         │
│                                                                 │
│  Vet Economics:                                                 │
│  • $40 per consultation (vet receives)                          │
│  • $10 per consultation (PetPulse fee)                          │
│  • Avg 5-10 consultations/week per vet                          │
│  • Top earners: $2-3K/month part-time                           │
│                                                                 │
│  Coverage:                                                      │
│  • 7am-11pm ET coverage                                         │
│  • <10 minute average response time                             │
│  • 95% consultation completion rate                             │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Vet Recruitment & Onboarding

**Recruitment Criteria:**
- Licensed DVM in good standing
- 3+ years clinical experience
- Strong communication skills
- Telehealth experience (preferred)
- Malpractice insurance current

**Onboarding Process:**
```
Day 0: Application received
Day 1-2: Screening interview
Day 3-5: Background/license verification
Day 5-7: Contract + agreement signing
Day 7-10: Platform training (2 hours)
Day 10-14: Shadow calls (5 consultations)
Day 14: Go live
```

**Ongoing Requirements:**
- Quarterly QA review (call recordings)
- Annual license verification
- Continuing education (8 hours/year)
- Patient satisfaction monitoring

### Vet Scheduling & Coverage

**Coverage Model:**

| Time Slot | Vets On-Call | Coverage |
|-----------|--------------|----------|
| 7am-10am | 3 | Morning rush |
| 10am-2pm | 2 | Midday |
| 2pm-6pm | 3 | Afternoon rush |
| 6pm-9pm | 4 | Evening peak |
| 9pm-11pm | 2 | Late night |
| 11pm-7am | 1 | Emergency only |

**Scheduling System:**
- Vets self-schedule via platform
- Minimum 4-hour shifts
- Shift swaps allowed with approval
- Holiday premium pay (1.5x)

### Vet Quality Assurance

**QA Metrics:**

| Metric | Target | Action if Below |
|--------|--------|-----------------|
| Response Time | <10 min | Schedule review |
| Consultation Rating | 4.5+/5 | Coaching call |
| Completion Rate | 95%+ | Warning |
| No-Show Rate | <2% | Suspension |
| Compliance Score | 100% | Immediate review |

**QA Process:**
- 5% of calls randomly reviewed monthly
- Customer complaints trigger immediate review
- Quarterly performance reviews
- Annual recertification

## Technology Operations

### System Architecture Overview

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                 │
│  ┌───────────┐    ┌───────────┐    ┌───────────┐               │
│  │  Mobile   │    │  Backend  │    │  Collar   │               │
│  │   App     │◀──▶│   API     │◀──▶│ Firmware  │               │
│  │ (iOS/And) │    │  (Node)   │    │  (BLE)    │               │
│  └───────────┘    └─────┬─────┘    └───────────┘               │
│                         │                                       │
│         ┌───────────────┼───────────────┐                       │
│         │               │               │                       │
│         ▼               ▼               ▼                       │
│  ┌───────────┐   ┌───────────┐   ┌───────────┐                 │
│  │ Database  │   │  AI/ML    │   │ Telehealth│                 │
│  │ (Postgres)│   │ Pipeline  │   │ (Video)   │                 │
│  └───────────┘   └───────────┘   └───────────┘                 │
│                                                                 │
│  Infrastructure: AWS (us-east-1)                                │
│  Monitoring: DataDog                                            │
│  Logging: CloudWatch                                            │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Uptime & Reliability Targets

| System | Target Uptime | RTO | RPO |
|--------|---------------|-----|-----|
| Backend API | 99.9% | 4 hours | 1 hour |
| Mobile App | 99.5% | 8 hours | 24 hours |
| Telehealth | 99.9% | 2 hours | 15 min |
| AI Pipeline | 99.0% | 8 hours | 4 hours |
| Database | 99.99% | 1 hour | 15 min |

**Incident Severity Levels:**

| Level | Definition | Response Time | Example |
|-------|------------|---------------|---------|
| SEV1 | Full outage | 15 minutes | API down, no consultations |
| SEV2 | Major degradation | 1 hour | Slow API, partial features |
| SEV3 | Minor issue | 4 hours | Non-critical bug, cosmetic |
| SEV4 | Enhancement | 24 hours | Feature request, improvement |

### On-Call Rotation

**Engineering On-Call:**
- Weekly rotation (7 days)
- Primary + secondary engineer
- 15-minute response SLA (SEV1/2)
- Escalation to CTO if unresolved in 1 hour

**On-Call Tools:**
- PagerDuty for alerting
- Slack #incidents channel
- Runbooks in Notion
- Status page (status.petpulse.com)

### Release Management

**Release Schedule:**
- App: Bi-weekly releases (Tuesday)
- Backend: Weekly deployments (Thursday)
- Firmware: Quarterly updates (OTA)

**Release Process:**
```
1. Code review + approval
2. Staging deployment
3. QA verification (automated + manual)
4. Staged rollout (10% → 50% → 100%)
5. Monitoring for 24 hours
6. Rollback if issues detected
```

---

## Data & Analytics Operations

### Data Collection

**Customer Data:**
- Account info (name, email, address)
- Pet profiles (name, breed, age, weight)
- Health data (vitals, activity, alerts)
- App usage (sessions, features used)
- Support interactions

**Business Data:**
- Orders, revenue, refunds
- Subscription status, churn
- Marketing attribution
- Vet network metrics

### Data Privacy & Compliance

**Compliance Requirements:**
- CCPA (California)
- GDPR (if serving EU)
- PCI-DSS (payment processing)
- HIPAA (not required for pet health)

**Data Retention:**
- Account data: Duration of account + 2 years
- Health data: 7 years (vet records standard)
- Payment data: 7 years (tax requirements)
- Marketing data: 2 years or until opt-out

**Data Security:**
- Encryption at rest (AES-256)
- Encryption in transit (TLS 1.3)
- Access controls (role-based)
- Audit logging
- Annual security review

### Analytics & Reporting

**Daily Metrics (Automated):**
- Orders, revenue, refunds
- Active users (DAU/WAU/MAU)
- Support tickets opened/closed
- Telehealth consultations
- System uptime

**Weekly Reports:**
- Acquisition funnel conversion
- Retention cohort update
- NPS score trend
- Revenue vs forecast
- Top support issues

**Monthly Reports:**
- Full P&L review
- Customer health scorecard
- Vet network performance
- Product roadmap progress
- Board-ready summary

---

## Financial Operations

### Revenue Operations

**Subscription Billing:**
- Monthly: Billed on anniversary date
- Annual: Billed on signup date
- Payment retry: 3 attempts over 5 days
- Dunning: Email sequence Days 1, 3, 5
- Churn: After 14-day grace period

**Payment Processing:**
- Provider: Stripe
- Methods: Credit/debit cards, Apple Pay, Google Pay
- Fraud prevention: Stripe Radar

### Expense Management

**Approval Levels:**

| Amount | Approver |
|--------|----------|
| <$500 | Department head |
| $500-$5,000 | CEO |
| >$5,000 | CEO + Board notification |

**Expense Categories:**
- Payroll (60% of opex)
- AWS/Infrastructure (10%)
- Marketing (15%)
- Tools/Software (5%)
- Travel/Events (5%)
- Other (5%)

### Cash Management

**Cash Targets:**
- Minimum runway: 12 months
- Target runway: 18 months
- Reserve fund: 3 months opex

**Cash Forecasting:**
- Weekly 13-week cash forecast
- Monthly burn rate tracking
- Quarterly reforecast

## Team Operations

### Communication Cadence

**Daily:**
- Morning standup (15 min) - All teams
- Slack async updates - Engineering
- Metrics dashboard review - Leadership

**Weekly:**
- All-hands meeting (30 min) - Monday
- Department syncs (30 min each) - Tuesday
- Product/Engineering planning - Wednesday
- 1:1s (30 min each) - Throughout week

**Monthly:**
- Monthly business review (2 hours)
- Team retrospective (1 hour)
- Customer feedback review (1 hour)

**Quarterly:**
- OKR review and planning (half day)
- Board meeting (2 hours)
- Team offsite (optional)

### Documentation Standards

**Required Documentation:**
- All processes in Notion
- Code documentation in repo
- API docs auto-generated
- Runbooks for operations
- Decision logs for major choices

**Notion Structure:**
```
PetPulse Workspace
├── Company
│   ├── Strategy & Vision
│   ├── OKRs
│   └── Meeting Notes
├── Product
│   ├── Roadmap
│   ├── Specs
│   └── Research
├── Engineering
│   ├── Architecture
│   ├── Runbooks
│   └── Incidents
├── Operations
│   ├── Playbooks
│   ├── Processes
│   └── Metrics
└── People
    ├── Handbook
    ├── Onboarding
    └── Policies
```

### Hiring & Onboarding

**Hiring Process:**
```
1. Job posting (LinkedIn, AngelList, referrals)
2. Resume screen (24-48 hour turnaround)
3. Phone screen (30 min)
4. Technical/Functional interview (1-2 hours)
5. Culture interview (1 hour)
6. Reference checks (2-3)
7. Offer (within 48 hours of decision)
```

**Onboarding (First 90 Days):**

| Week | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Week 1 | Setup, company overview, team introductions |
| Week 2 | Product deep-dive, shadow sessions |
| Week 3-4 | First project/ticket with guidance |
| Month 2 | Independent work, feedback session |
| Month 3 | Full contribution, 90-day review |

## Risk Management

### Operational Risks

| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|------------|--------|------------|
| Hardware defect batch | Medium | High | QC at factory, batch testing |
| Vet network shortage | Low | High | Over-recruit 20%, backup vets |
| Data breach | Low | Critical | Security audit, insurance |
| Service outage | Medium | Medium | Multi-AZ, monitoring |
| Supply chain delay | Medium | Medium | 90-day inventory buffer |
| Key employee departure | Medium | Medium | Documentation, cross-training |

### Business Continuity

**Critical Functions:**
1. Telehealth availability (vet consultations)
2. App functionality (customer access)
3. Support operations (issue resolution)
4. Order fulfillment (new customers)

**Backup Plans:**

| Function | Backup Plan |
|----------|-------------|
| Telehealth | Partner vet service (emergency) |
| App | Web fallback for critical features |
| Support | Email-only mode, extended SLA |
| Fulfillment | Backup 3PL, expedited shipping |

---

## Vendor Management

### Key Vendors

| Vendor | Service | Contract | Backup |
|--------|---------|----------|--------|
| [3PL] | Fulfillment | Annual | [Backup 3PL] |
| AWS | Infrastructure | Monthly | GCP (documented) |
| Stripe | Payments | Monthly | Braintree |
| Intercom | Support | Annual | Zendesk |
| [Manufacturer] | Hardware | Per-PO | [Backup Mfr] |
| Twilio | Video/SMS | Monthly | Vonage |

### Vendor SLAs

| Vendor | SLA | Penalty |
|--------|-----|---------|
| 3PL | 99% same-day ship | Credit |
| AWS | 99.99% uptime | Credit |
| Stripe | 99.9% uptime | N/A |
| Manufacturer | 95% on-time delivery | Cost reduction |

## Implementation Checklist

### Pre-Launch (Weeks -4 to 0)

- [ ] Support system configured (Intercom)
- [ ] Knowledge base created (100+ articles)
- [ ] Vet network recruited (50+ vets)
- [ ] Fulfillment partner integrated
- [ ] Monitoring & alerting live
- [ ] On-call rotation established
- [ ] Runbooks documented
- [ ] Status page configured

### Launch Week

- [ ] All-hands readiness check
- [ ] Support team on high alert
- [ ] Engineering war room
- [ ] Hourly metrics review
- [ ] Customer feedback monitoring
- [ ] Issue escalation path confirmed

### Post-Launch (Weeks 1-4)

- [ ] Daily metrics review
- [ ] Weekly operations retrospective
- [ ] Process refinement based on learnings
- [ ] Playbook updates
- [ ] Team feedback collection

---

## Summary

### Operational Principles

1. **Systems over heroics** - Build processes that scale
2. **Measure everything** - Data-driven decisions
3. **Customer obsession** - Every interaction matters
4. **Documentation first** - Enable team scaling
5. **Continuous improvement** - Iterate on operations

### Success Metrics

| Metric | Launch | 6 Months | 12 Months |
|--------|--------|----------|-----------|
| Support CSAT | 85% | 88% | 90% |
| Vet Response Time | 12 min | 10 min | 8 min |
| System Uptime | 99.5% | 99.8% | 99.9% |
| Fulfillment Accuracy | 98% | 99% | 99.5% |
| Gross Margin | 55% | 60% | 65% |
